Articles.Content:
A recent thread revealed there are quiet a few eagle scouts on this forum, and I thought it would be cool to have a thread about it. Have you gotten your eagle scout award? Let me know on this thread and I'll add your name to the list of Forum User Eagle Scouts! Are you a boyscout striving towards eagle? I'll put your name under the In progress list! Were you a boy scout, but never made Eagle? That's alright too! I'll put your name under the Forum User Boy Scout list.

Feel free to also include any honors your got, how many merit badges you received (if you know) as well as your Eagle palms. I'll include these with your name. (not a competition, therefor I won't reveal which awards are the most prestigious, they will just be listed)

Alright, here are the lists!

Forum User Eagle Scouts!

DuoDex - Eagle Scout, and Sea Scout! Also a forum moderator, feel free to PM him if you need anything!

Avera9eJoe - Eagle Scout, ~33 Merit Badges!

Slam_Jones - Eagle Scout, Sea Scout, and Venturer!

Im The One - Eagle Scout, ~23 Merit Badges!

Dman979 - Eagle Scout, Gold Palms!, OA Member, National Outdoor Award - Camping, Religious Award, Messengers of Peace, Varsity Scout Letter, 7 (going on 8) year tenure pin as a scout, a silver device for my NOA- Camping, Union League of Philadelphia Good Citizenship Award, Completed Philmont Trek! Congrats!, bunchofothermoldystuffintheretm

PaulK - Eagle Scout, Silver Palms!

Wood Badge

pincushionman - Eagle Scout!

adsii1970 - Eagle Scout, 68 merit badges, 3 silver palms!, Explorer Achievement Award (1987), Arrow of Light (1980), Silver Beaver (2010), Brotherhood member, OA.

Wesreidau - Eagle Scout, Gold Palms, OA member!

Superfreak784 - Eagle Scout!

datubaman - Eagle Scout, OA Member!

Kozak - Eagle Scout!  NYLT, OA, Oakleaf, Bronze Eagle palm, Kozak is also the youngest Eagle Scout in his troops history!

@Gyrfalcon - Eagle Scout, OA!

Endersmens (me) - Newest Eagle Scout! Got eagle on April 27th, 2016.

Dman979 likes this  Like this

well, just waiting to add your name now!

Edited May 7, 2016 by Endersmens
Added new scouts, and Congrats Dman for completing the Philmont trek!

Am of Eagle.

-snip-

Edited May 20, 2015 by DuoDex
I am a star, almost to life
Star almost life. Kind of moved over to Venturing though.
Life Scout - Finishing up last 2 merit badges will have Eagle before october garunteed.

Am of Eagle.

Edit : Not everyone here is in the U.S., so maybe you could change the post to reflect that?

I am a star, almost to life
Star almost life. Kind of moved over to Venturing though.
Life Scout - Finishing up last 2 merit badges will have Eagle before october garunteed.

All Added!

briansun1, I'm also more in to venturing now. It is a lot more relaxed and fun to me. But I still plan on finishing Eagle.
Same here. The level of maturity between BSA and Venturing is kind of crazy. At-least in my experience.

Same here. The level of maturity between BSA and Venturing is kind of crazy. At-least in my experience.

Yeah, boy scouts has kinda turned into a stereotypical horde of sweaty 11 year olds being loud an obnoxious....it was a lot cooler when everyone was more mature than you.

Venturing to me more resembles a group of more mature teenagers who like the outdoors and having fun. Plus its not gender specific, so I get to have fun outdoors and stuff with my girlfriend. (her dad is the leader of the venture crew we started)
Was a Boy Scout (1960's), and then a Sea Scout (early 1970's).

Was a Boy Scout (1960's), and then a Sea Scout (early 1970's).

Do you remember what rank you achieved? Also, I'll add Sea Scout to the end of yours.

Do you remember what rank you achieved? Also, I'll add Sea Scout to the end of yours.

Gads... no... second class at least, maybe made first class... I really don't remember. I never made Eagle, I know that. I spent more time at the Sea Scout base than I did with my scout troop (even before I was in Boy Scouts), and switched over to Sea Scouts early at age 11? or 12. My dad and three of his friends started (and ran) the Sea Scout unit I was in; They started it after they came home from the Korean War... they were all scouts in the 1930's-40's, and Navy during the war. Navy family!

Gads... no... second class at least, maybe made first class... I really don't remember. I never made Eagle, I know that. I spent more time at the Sea Scout base than I did with my scout troop (even before I was in Boy Scouts), and switched over to Sea Scouts early at age 11? or 12. My dad and three of his friends started (and ran) the Sea Scout unit I was in; They started it after they came home from the Korean War... they were all scouts in the 1930's-40's, and Navy during the war. Navy family!

Wow! I will put you under the Boy scouts title, with the Sea Scouts thing also. Is there a certain rank you had in the Sea Scouts that I could put? Did you finish it? Was there such thing as finishing it?
I am an eagle! I have no palms, and I can't say how many merit badges I had... I had something like 10-15 more then required. Including space exploration .

I am an eagle! I have no palms, and I can't say how many merit badges I had... I had something like 10-15 more then required. Including space exploration .

I'll put you down as Eagle scout with ~33 merit badges.

Space and Exploration was one of my firsts, and that was before KSP was a thing!

Eagle Scout here!

Troop 731: Fallbrook, CA

Earned Eagle a day before I turned 18 (cutting it as close as possible... not recommended).

No idea how many badges I earned... it was more than required, though, that's for sure.

Theoretically I would've earned a few palms if I hadn't gotten Eagle at the last minute... no regrets though.

Truthfully, (as is the case for most Eagle Scouts I know) my mother is the one that should have earned it

Edit: Also done a little Venturing and more than a little Sea Scouts. Also volunteered as an adult helper for a few years.

Edited May 20, 2015 by Slam_Jones

I also was a Sea Scout, and I had a couple arguments with the leaders about precise measurements. They said all we had to do was learn GPS, I was more in favor of GPS + celestial navigation, although I'd be hard pressed to use a sextant now.

Wow! I will put you under the Boy scouts title, with the Sea Scouts thing also. Is there a certain rank you had in the Sea Scouts that I could put? Did you finish it? Was there such thing as finishing it?

I think I only made it to 'Seaman'. Eventually I got wrapped up with other things... high school, Crew team (which was right next to the Sea Scout base lol), etc. I remember that membership was waning, not too many were interested in it. In searching the web, I found this article... sad to see.
I am an eagle with no palms. I had, i want to say, 22-24 merit badges

I am an eagle! I have no palms, and I can't say how many merit badges I had... I had something like 10-15 more then required. Including space exploration .

No idea how many badges I earned... it was more than required, though, that's for sure.

Theoretically I would've earned a few palms if I hadn't gotten Eagle at the last minute... no regrets though.

Truthfully, (as is the case for most Eagle Scouts I know) my mother is the one that should have earned it

Edit: Also done a little Venturing and more than a little Sea Scouts. Also volunteered as an adult helper for a few years.

I also was a Sea Scout, and I had a couple arguments with the leaders about precise measurements. They said all we had to do was learn GPS, I was more in favor of GPS + celestial navigation, although I'd be hard pressed to use a sextant now.
I am an eagle with no palms. I had, i want to say, 22-24 merit badges

Added! Also DuoDex I added Sea Scout! I think I'm gonna add Venturer too, so in a bit I'll add that.

Edited May 20, 2015 by DuoDex
very abuse of mod power to correct spelling of my name

I'm an Eagle Scout, Class of 1990 with Silver Palm.

I just completed my Wood Badge this past weekend. That was like doing 5 Eagle projects in a year's time (though we had 18 months).

Congratulations on Wood Badge!

I'm possibly? the most recent Eagle on the forums. I got my BoR on March 12th, and my paperwork came in from National on Friday. Woot!

I've got two palms earned, just need to wait until my birthday.

I'm heading to Philmont this summer. I'm even more hyped for this than for 1.0!

I've also got the National Outdoor Award in Camping, my religious award, and a bunch of other moldy old stuff there.

I just completed my Wood Badge this past weekend. That was like doing 5 Eagle projects in a year's time (though we had 18 months).

Congratulations on Wood Badge!

Both added!

Side note: I've decided not to reveal which awards are the most prestigious (IE palms and such) to keep this as far away from a competition as possible. If you guys think the competition part won't be a problem, I'm also fine with giving a list of awards and such, and saying which are the highest in prestige. What do you guys think?
I think you made a good choice. I'd leave it how it is.
Forum User Boy Scouts. Was a Star (almost Life). Then into Venturing.
Currently a first class scout. Cool to see that there are plenty of other Boy Scouts.
